contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=July 2009}} '''Parsenn''', renowned ski area near [[Davos, Switzerland]], offering 35 ski runs. [[Image:Parsenn ski slopes.jpg|thumb|left|The ski slopes at Parsenn]] [[Image:Parsennbahn.jpg|thumb|The new Parsennbahn cable car]] [[Image:Parsenn red railway.jpg|thumb|right|Former "Red railway" car ascending the funicular]] The recently updated Parsenn "red railway" [[funicular]] covers the difference of 1100 meters to the [[Weissfluhjoch]] ridge. You can also get from [[Klosters]] to Gotschna/Parsenn with a large cable car. Ski runs from here run up to 17 kilometers into the [[Pr채ttigau]] valley, one of them used in the [[Parsenn Derby Race]]. The Parsenn area is the largest and most modern of Davos' five mountains. On Fridays from mid-December to mid-March the slope is also open until 11pm offering floodlit night skiing. {{Coord|46.84|N|9.81|E|region:CH-GR|display=title}} [[Category:Geography of Switzerland]] [[Category:Ski areas and resorts in Switzerland]] [[Category:Funicular railways in Switzerland]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Graub체nden]] [[Category:1200 mm gauge railways]] [[Category:800 mm gauge railways]] [[Category:Visitor attractions in Graub체nden]] {{Graub체nden-geo-stub}} {{Switzerland-sports-venue-stub}}
